results.title: The Human Jigsaw
results.brief_description: This documentary, that tells of one of Australia’s most successful efforts to fight drug addiction, is a “no holds barred” view on Odyssey House in Sydney and its drug rehabilitation program told by the residents undergoing treatment. It shows the progressive degradation of people through drug addiction to the depths of despair and hopelessness and the way in which the Odyssey program rebuilds shattered lives. The story addresses the cynicism of many people to the problems and reasons of addiction and cure.

results.title: The Human image: masculinity/femininity
results.creator_credit: Diantha Fielding, CBS and Kent Smith
results.brief_description: Contemporary account of changes to gender roles and social identity. The marriage of a young couple and their subsequent struggle to make their relationship work provides continuity in a montage of dramatised and animated scenes showing the feelings, ideas, fantasies and images inherent in sex role expectations for men and women in our society. The effects of stereotyping in relationship between the sexes and in individual lives raise provocative questions for discussions. Although ostensibly challenging traditional stereotypes, the program promotes more than a few itself, eg exclusive WASP cast in the dramatised segments; no reference to homosexuality, etc. Animation: M. Borczynski.

results.title: The Human heart
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Dr. Christiaan Barnard and other eminent heart surgeons demonstrate the latest techniques for treatment and possible prevention of heart disease. Probable new developments are discussed. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Human factor
results.creator_credit: Jill Wood, Robert McIntosh and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Basis for Decision”.
Unlike the other films in the series, the Operational Research scientists here look at two studies in which the central problems were human ones. One study was to find how to reduce labour wastage at collieries, the other studied a hospital with high staff turnover and which kept patients longer. Also looks to future potential - in advertising and human relations in industry; in town planning and local government; in transport policy and economic planning in central government.

results.title: The Human face of the Pacific
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, Oliver Howes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A series of six documentaries covering six Pacific nations and territories, giving a wide-ranging view of contemporary Pacific society. It shows the variety of ways of life from subsistence to urbanization and the challenges from outside of what has been called the “Pacific way”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis O’Rourke, Oliver Howes and Film Australia

results.title: The Human face of Indonesia
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Film Australia, David Roberts, David Haythornthwaite and John Darling
results.brief_description: Consists of five programs that look at the lives of five very diverse people, each giving an insight into life in Indonesia today. Examines the trans-migration program, the plight of Java’s low income groups, the administrators of one of Indonesia’s poorest provinces and a Dalang man who is trying to keep alive his ancient Hindu religion where Islam is the official state religion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rob McAuley, Film Australia, David Roberts, David Haythornthwaite and John Darling

results.title: The Human face [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, James Erskine and David Stewart
results.brief_description: Comedian John Cleese and actor/model Liz Hurley present this BBC television documentary series exploring the dimensions of the human face, including its creation, function, sexuality, communication, identity and perception. Also features appearances by Michael Palin, Pierce Brosnan, Joan Rivers, Candice Bergen and David Attenborough. The four parts to the series are ‘Face to Face’, ‘Here’s Looking at You!’, ‘Beauty’ and ‘Fame’.

results.title: The Human eye
results.brief_description: Shows the structure and properties of the human eye. Using models, animated diagrams and photography, the film explains lens, iris, sclera, cornea, aqueous humor, retina, cones, neruons, the choroid layer and the fovea centralis. Suitable for secondary level.
